text: If you have an iPhone 8 or newer
running on iOS 13 or newer,

you can connect two sets
of AirPods to one device.
Start by connecting your own AirPods.
Go to settings, then Bluetooth,
and toggle Bluetooth on.
Next, tap your AirPods to connect.

Now open an app you
want to play audio from.
I'll use Spotify.
Once you're in Spotify,
tap the devices widget in the bottom left.
Then tap "AirPlay or Bluetooth."
Tap on your AirPods' name to connect.
You'll know the pairing is successful
when you see a white check mark
next to the headphones.

Note that you might
need to do this process
a couple times before they connect.
Once they're connected,

the words "Share Audio" should
appear below the AirPods.
Tap "Share Audio."

Next, take the case from
the second pair of AirPods
and hold it up to your phone.
Make sure both AirPods are in the case
while you're doing this.
Eventually, the second set of AirPods
will appear on your screen,

but note that it can take
a while and a few tries.
Now tap "Share Audio" again.
Hold the button on the back

of the second AirPods' case
to connect to the phone.
Once they pair, tap "Done."
Both AirPods should now be connected.

You should see separate
volume-control sliders
under each pair of headphones.
